title: Peter Hurley: Headshot Photography Philosophy & Techniques
summary: Renowned photographer Peter Hurley shares his journey from Olympic sailor to headshot expert, emphasizing the power of mindset and demonstrating his directing techniques for capturing engaging portraits.

steps.action: Direct the subject to push their chin out and down to define the jawline.
Adopt a mindset of success through self-affirmation ('Tell yourself a lie long enough until you believe it').
Use a large scrim or diffuser to soften harsh sunlight when shooting outdoors.
Instruct the subject to pull hair up and separate it to create volume and frame the face.
Have the subject move or spin slowly while shooting continuously to capture natural expressions.

key_takeaways: Belief in oneself is a critical component of professional success.
Directing the subject's posture (chin out and down) is essential for flattering headshots.
Creating movement during a session helps loosen up the subject for better photos.
Pursue what you genuinely think is 'cool' to find fulfillment in your work.
